title: Open Educational Practices Based on DBIR Methodology for Learning Design and OER Utilization

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Program designed to strengthen social studies educational competencies for corporate managers/leaders, focusing on visual and interactive learning design using digital devices

learning_goals: Participants can design three educational objectives required in real work environments using the four phases (Define, Build, Implement, Review) of DBIR methodology and demonstrate flexible instructional design capabilities by achieving an average of 4 or higher on a 5-point rubric through peer evaluation.
Participants can produce three or more adaptable instructional designs using OER-based open educational resources
Participants can create and share visual and multimodal learning design artifacts using digital tools (such as the DEPIT app).

Participants can select three open-ended educational practices (e.g., discussion workshops, feedback routine design) to promote learner engagement in corporate training settings and apply them to two or more educational sessions over six months, achieving an average satisfaction score of 4 or higher (5-point scale).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
